He was, as he tells us himself (Epist. vn 20), in his eighteenth year when the famous eruption of Vesuvius took place (a 1). 79), and he must therefore have been born nn. 61 or 62. We are inclined to put the date of the birth ol Tacitus at least ten years earlier. . ln this conclusion we are supported by the passage which we find in the third chapter of the life of Agricola.
